newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan chip makers boosting 64-MB DRAM output-paper.
newsitem.headline: Japan chip makers boosting 64-MB DRAM output-paper.

text.p: Japanese semiconductor makers are increasing output of 64-megabit dynamic random access memory (DRAM) chips against the backdrop of sluggish 16-megabit DRAM market, a Japanese newspaper said on Tuesday.

The Nihon Keizai Shimbun economic daily said that some market sources are already worried about the possibility of oversupply of 64-megabit chips because South Korean makers are also shifting from 16-megabit chips. Fujitsu Ltd, for example, is expected to implement its plan to produce one million 64-megabit DRAM chips a month in 1997, earlier than it originally planned, the paper said.
